intro: Secamone finlaysonii, commonly known as the Finlayson's secamone, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically opposite and oval-shaped, with a smooth texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
